intro: Deppea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Deppea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Loganiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
